name: Mercury
facts: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system
It has the most extreme temperature swings of any planet in our solar system
A day on Mercury (the time it takes for one rotation) is longer than its year (the time it takes to complete one orbit around the Sun)

name: Venus
atmosphere: Primarily composed of carbon dioxide (96.5%) with nitrogen and trace amounts of other gases
facts: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system, with surface temperatures hot enough to melt lead
It has the longest day of any planet in our solar system, taking 243 Earth days to complete one rotation
Venus rotates in the opposite direction to most other planets in our solar system

name: Earth
atmosphere: Primarily composed of nitrogen (78%) and oxygen (21%) with trace amounts of other gases
facts: Earth is the only known planet to support life
It has a magneticfield created by its iron core, which helps to protect the planet from harmful solar radiation
The highest point on Earth is Mount Everest, which stands at 8,848 meters above sea level

name: Mars
atmosphere: Primarily composed of carbon dioxide (95%) with nitrogen and argon
facts: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to the iron oxide (rust) on its surface
It has the largest volcano (Olympus Mons) and the deepest canyon (Valles Marineris) in our solar system
Mars has a thin atmosphere, with a surface pressure only about 1% of Earth's

name: Jupiter
atmosphere: Primarily composed of hydrogen (89%) and helium (10%) with trace amounts of other gases
facts: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system
It has the most moons of any planet in our solar system
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a massive storm that has been raging for at least 350 years

name: Saturn
atmosphere: Primarily composed of hydrogen (96%) with helium and trace amounts of other gases
facts: Saturn is known for its prominent and extensive ring system, which is made up of ice particles
It has the second largest moon in our solar system, Titan, which is larger than the planet Mercury
Saturn has a hexagonal shaped weather pattern at its north pole

name: Uranus
atmosphere: Primarily composed of hydrogen (83%) and helium (15%) with trace amounts of other gases
facts: Uranus is the first planet discovered using a telescope
It is tilted at an extreme angle, with its axis of rotation almost parallel to the plane of the solar system
Uranus has a very cold and windy atmosphere, with wind speeds reaching up to 900 km/h

name: Neptune
discoveredBy: Urbain Le Verrier and Johann Galle
atmosphere: Primarily composed of hydrogen (80%) and helium (19%) with trace amounts of other gases
facts: Neptune is the farthest planet from the sun in our solar system
It has the strongest winds of any planet in our solar system, with wind speeds reaching up to 2,100 km/h
Neptune was the first planet to be discovered through mathematical predictions rather than through direct observations

details.recordedBy: Urbain Le Verrier and Johann Galle
